metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6881 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The zlib_refill function in libavformat/swfdec.c in FFmpeg before 3.1.3allows remote attackers to cause an infinite loop denial of service via acrafted SWF file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6881` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libav-tools - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg-extra56 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavcodec-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavdevice-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavfilter-ffmpeg5 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavformat-ffmpeg56 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavresample-ffmpeg2 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libavutil-ffmpeg54 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libpostproc-ffmpeg53 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswresample-ffmpeg1 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libswscale-ffmpeg3 - 7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
